It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed by all the different brush options in Procreate, especially when you're just starting out. Here are a few tips to help you get started:

1. Start with the basics. Procreate comes with a set of default brushes that are great for getting started. Experiment with these to get a feel for how the different brushes work and what they're best suited for.
2. Don't be afraid to delete brushes you don't like. Procreate allows you to customize your brush library by adding and deleting brushes. If you find that you're not using a particular brush, don't be afraid to delete it to simplify your options.
3. Experiment with different brush settings. Each brush has a set of adjustable settings that allow you to customize its behavior. Play around with these to see how they affect your brushstrokes.
4. Use reference images. If you're trying to achieve a particular look or effect with your brushes, try using reference images to get an idea of the brushstrokes and techniques you need to use.
5. Practice, practice, practice! The more you use Procreate and experiment with its tools, the more comfortable you'll become with them. Don't be afraid to make mistakes and try new things.

I hope these tips help! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, don't hesitate to ask.
